name: Hilton Tampa Airport Westshore

reviews.text: Arrived at the Hilton on Sunday May 25th and front desk was staffed and waiting. Clerk stated that they “upgraded” me to the 3rd floor smoking suites. On my online reservation I had noted a smoking room for my companion; however, I had also booked the executive floor which had balconies among other things that were included. When researching hotels, this was one highlight. I do not think that the front desk should have led me to believe that it was an upgrade, since in no way, shape or form was it one. It was actually a downgrade. Plus, upon check in my room was not ready and it was 2 hours after check in time. Amazingly thought they found another room right away. Hmm…..
reviews.title: Great Hotel - Trickey Front desk staff person

reviews.text: The in-house bar and pool area was great. Never tried the restaurant though. The complimentary breakfast served for the executive floor was very, very good. I would recommend this hotel to business and family groups. Just make sure to research the hotel website so the front desk does not fool you.
reviews.title: I've had better service.

likes.liked: — Close proximity to I-275 (Lois Avenue is an exit off the Interstate - you're about 10 mins from the road)
likes.disliked: — Stinky hotel room from the smokers - I think the 4th floor might have been converted to non-smoking recently - if you want smoking...3rd floor, please. :)

reviews.title: Great Service by the Airport
reviews.text: I stayed here on May 17, 2008. When I checked in, there was only one guy standing behind the check in counter on what seemed to be a pretty busy Sat. afternoon. He was busy catering to a group of elderly ladies with their luggage and then he was breaking change for someone else who just cut in front of me while waiting to check in and he was taking phone calls from guests already in the hotel. After standing in line for about 15-20 mins, he finally checks me in. The first room he sold me (on the 10th floor) had no air conditioning. The hallway was cooler than the room! When I opened the door, the room just smelled musty and it was HOT in there. I went back downstairs and told the guy, "Try again" and he sold me a room on the 4th floor (the 3rd floor is the smoking floor so I've been told) which had A/C, but you can smell the odor coming up from the 3rd floor. Since I was only there for one night, I sucked it up and settled in.

This hotel does seem to host alot of functions ranging from contractor licensing exams to business conferences to wedding receptions. I've stayed here before and every time I stay, there's always something going on here. The lobby always has people hanging out in it. If you're a people watcher - sit in the lounge (off the lobby) and just hang out.
reviews.title: O.K. but wouldn't stay there again

reviews.text: Oh.. as far as the restaurant goes....unless you want to shell out $16.00 for a breakfast buffet.....I say, "PASS!" go check out a Denny's or Perkins - you'll save about $9 per person...easily!
reviews.title: Recommended

likes.disliked: — it's very pedestrian, even for a Hilton

reviews.text: I did not stay at the hotel but we had our daughters wedding there. It was more than I could have asked for. The staff is the greatest. They made the reception perfect. The service was top notch as was the food. The chef did an outstanding job. Family members stayed at the hotel and the rooms were clean and spacious. The hotel is beautifully decorated. I would definitely host another event at this hotel and would highly reccommend it to anyone looking for a hotel in Tampa for a great price. My husband and I are European travelers and for the price of this Hilton you can't find a hole in the ground over there. Wonderful place!!!!
reviews.title: Great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is great. We stayed there to go to a Tampa Bay Buccaneers game. The shuttle worked out great and the drivers are all willing to help you anytime. The front desk staff are great too. The one gentleman Troy has got to be one of the friendliest people I have ever met. If you are going to Tampa definitely stay at this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: A very good hotel located near the airport. Great location, close to the airport, restaurants, shopping, and the highways. Tastefully decorated rooms and lobby. The rooms; however, seemed to be on the small side. The only things that I did not like about this hotel were that the beds, although comfortable, were two full size beds, instead of queens. Also, the heated pool was very cold. The weather was very nice but the water was too cold to swim. Also, no free internet access.
reviews.title: Great hotel, great location

likes.liked: — Location, decor, free shuttle to airport and mall
likes.disliked: — full-size bed, no free internet, and heated pool water too cold

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had breakfast buffet at the hotel restaurant (Coconuts?). It was a bit pricy at $16/ adult and $12/ children but food was very good. The workout facility was very good equipped with newer machines with TVs.
reviews.title: OK place to pass by on the way to somewhere

likes.disliked: — Near the airport, but no noise penetrates

reviews.text: Stayed for a night passing through. Rang the hotel via the courtesy phone at the airport, to get the shuttle bus - very effiicent.
reviews.title: One of the better hotel properties near the airport

reviews.text: I have stayed here many time during business trips to Tampa. The hotel is within a few minutes (shuttle) of the airport but also close to two shopping malls. I suppose you can walk to them, but Tampa is not a walking city and you really would be much better off with a car.
reviews.title: Standard airport hilton

reviews.text: There is nothing spectacular or horrendously bad about the hotel. It's a standard, Hilton airport hotel you'd find anywhere else in the US. There are no distinguishing features, nothing to make it stand out, etc. You could just as easily pick it up and plop it into any other US city and you'd never know the difference. That said, the rooms are big and clean, the a/c works well and there are lots and lots of cable channels. I would stay there again on business while in Tampa.
reviews.title: At least they smile when they say 'no'

reviews.text: I am a Hilton HHonors Gold member. They gave me a room next to a very noisy guest. When I went back to the front desk to complain and ask for another room (and believe me, the hotel was NOT full), the young lady smiled and said that she believed the neighbor next door would "calm down in a few minutes" Then she said that if not, she would "personally go up there and quiet things down." It was still noisy an hour later, so I went back to ask for another room and -- well, what a surprise -- the young lady had finished her shift and gone home.
reviews.title: Don't leave anything on the floor!

reviews.text: I was told that another room was out of the question "because some of the rooms are not in use" (!) but I WAS given a pass to the concierge lounge for breakfast the next day (this is usually done for Gold members at every hotel, but is an exception at this place).
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The lounge was dirty, with a very limited food selection and a very loud TV blasting out the Tampa murder statistics from the night before.
reviews.title: Perfect stay in Tampa

reviews.text: I can not say enough good things about this hotel.We came here cause our flight leaved a 6.45 am and we were at disney.We arrived at 10.30 pm We were given the top floor and we only paid 100 dollars off of hotels.com.What a steal.Once we arrived in our room it was spotless and sooooo big. The bed was sooooooooooo confertable and the sheets smelt really fresh.There was 2 bottels of water free and a free news paper in the morning.The elavator requries you to swip your card if you stay at the top floor.The room had a fridge and a coffe pot.It is 1 mile from the airport and the staff is very friendly and helpfull. I would strongly recamond this one to anybody.
reviews.title: Incredible

reviews.text: Stayed at the Hilton for three nights over the weekend... no problems at all. The staff was attentive and accomodating when required. The hotle can use a little updating, in fact there is a renovation scheduled to start 9/21.
reviews.title: Good Stay

likes.disliked: — Had to pay for Internet access

reviews.text: The hotel is located close to everything, shopping, restaurants, etc.
reviews.title: Skip the Hilton

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would stay there again.
reviews.title: Not what we expected

reviews.text: This hotel is located in very close proximity to the airport and the bay street shopping and restaurants. The restaurant here is HUGELY overpriced... the breakfast buffet will run you $18 plus tax and tip and is nothing huge. The lunch and dinner menus also looked expensive but there are plenty of places to eat across the street. There is also a shuttle that will take you within 5 miles, which is nice, but can be slow at times.
reviews.title: Nice, especially for the price

description: One of the best Tampa International Airport hotels offering exceptional service and the closest proximity of International Plaza hotels with complimentary Tampa Airport shuttle service from 5am-1am. Not many hotels near downtown Tampa can compete with our location in Westshore within easy access to International Plaza, Raymond James Stadium, Cigar City Brewery and Ybor City.
